challengeName: topcoder - Challenge List Not Loading in HTTPS Bug Fix Challenge
detailedRequirements:
The goal of this challenge is to fix the issue in Challenge Listing page that does not load the challenge list when viewing over HTTPS. 

Task Overview

When loading the page via HTTPS, you will only see the header and footer and no challenge list. You'll either need some logic to detect if the page is served via https or if you can call the external scripts with // leaving off the http: (see this page for reference https://blog.httpwatch.com/2010/02/10/using-protocol-relative-urls-to-switch-between-http-and-https/ ) 

The page to check that needs to work in both http and https are:

- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges

- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/design/active/
- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/design/past/
- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/design/upcoming/

- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/develop/active/
- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/develop/past/
- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/develop/upcoming/

- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/data/active/
- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/data/past/
- https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/data/upcoming/ 

Resources and Guidelines:
- Latest theme and plugin available on GitLab https://gitlab.com/topcoderinc/tc-site/tree/master. You will need to create an account in GitLab if you haven't had yet, once you register for this challenge, send us GitLab login to jamesmarquez@gmail.com and we will add you to the developers group on a repo in GitLab. This will give you access to work on issues, create branches, and pull requests.
- Data is available on https://github.com/topcoderinc/tc-site-data 
- Please follow the guideline in our GitLab repo 

Quick Installation guide :
1. Activate theme and plugin
2. Import provided XML file
3. Set home as front page
4. Set permalink to %post_name%
5. Please install site on local.topcoder.com (add to hosts file), so your local site can read tcsso and tcjwt cookie
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
- Please submit updated files and Patch file
- Any new js or css file must be included in the registry. Learn about this on script and style registry section
- Once the winner is declared, create a branch and submit merge request
